message.content: Yucca schidigera is a flowering plant that belongs to the family Asparagaceae. It is commonly known as Mojave yucca or Spanish dagger. Its leaves are evergreen, stiff, and blade-like. They grow in a rosette pattern at the base of the plant with each leaf measuring up to 90cm. The plant is characterized by a tall, woody stem that can grow up to 10 meters in height. Its flowers are creamy-white and bell-shaped with a size of approximately 6cm and form clusters on a tall spike. It is found in the southwestern United States, Baja California, and northwestern Mexico, where it grows in rocky, dry environments such as deserts and arid regions. It is popular for its medicinal properties and is used in dietary supplements, medicines, and animal feed.
